intro: Pisonia artensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Pisonia artensis is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
